title: 112_hr6040
content: The Act titled "Continued Free Association with Palau Act of 2012" is cited in Section 1. Section 2 involves the approval of an agreement related to the 15th-anniversary review of Compact Section 432. The Agreement between the United States and Palau, signed in 2010, is approved with exceptions and subject to certain provisions. Funding provisions for infrastructure maintenance in fiscal year 2011 are outlined. The Agreement between the United States and Palau, signed in 2010, is approved with exceptions and subject to certain provisions. Funding provisions for infrastructure maintenance in fiscal year 2011 are outlined, including amounts to be provided by the United States and Palau in fiscal year 2013. Funding for infrastructure projects and a fiscal consolidation fund are also detailed. In fiscal year 2012, the United States will reduce funding by $411,000 under section 5 of the Agreement for infrastructure projects. Congress consents to amendments in the Compact subsidiary agreements. The Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 will have the year 2024 substituted for 2009. Authorization of appropriations includes $1,500,000 for postal services. In fiscal year 2012, funding will be reduced by $411,000 for infrastructure projects. The Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 will substitute the year 2024 for 2009. Authorization of appropriations includes $1,500,000 for postal services related to Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands. The Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 extends appropriations for infrastructure projects in Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands through fiscal year 2024. The Act also ensures that funds remain available until expended and applies full faith and credit to commitments of the United States under the Compact Review Agreement. The Compact Review Agreement requires audits and financial commitments to be conducted, with oversight by the Secretary of the Interior for US domestic programs in Palau. Congressional committees receive annual reports on these matters. The Secretary of the Interior must submit an annual report to Senate and House committees on the use and effectiveness of financial assistance provided to Palau under US domestic programs. The Secretary consults with relevant Federal agencies in preparing these reports. The Secretary of the Interior consults with relevant Federal agencies in preparing annual reports on the use and effectiveness of financial assistance provided to Palau under US domestic programs. SEC. 3. OFFSETS. Repeals prior authorization for civil administration of Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands and adds a limitation on the use of funds for global health programs under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. SEC. 136. LIMITATION ON USE OF FUNDS. None of the funds for global health activities from fiscal year 2012 to 2024 can be used for assistance to China. The total amount for global health activities is reduced by $2,000,000 each fiscal year. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. ``(a) Limitation.--Funds for climate change activities from 2012 to 2024 cannot be used for assistance to China. The total amount for such activities is reduced by $4,500,000 each fiscal year. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. (d) Prohibition on Funding for Development Innovation Ventures (DIV) Program.'' The Development Innovation Ventures (DIV) program funding is prohibited for fiscal years 2012 and 2013 by the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The total amount available for the United States Agency for International Development is reduced by $28,200,000. This restriction applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 prohibits the use of funds for assistance to Argentina from fiscal year 2012 through 2024. The total amount available for activities under this chapter is reduced by $4,500,000 annually. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 reduces the total amount available for activities by $4,500,000 annually, regardless of any other laws enacted after this provision. "SEC. 308. LIMITATION ON USE OF FUNDS." Limitation on the use of funds for United States contributions to the United Nations, specifically to UNESCO, with a reduction of $4,500,000 for each fiscal year until 2024. This restriction applies regardless of any other laws enacted. The United States Institute of Peace has a limitation on funds, with a total amount of $6,811,000 less than the total amount available for fiscal years 2012 to 2024. This restriction applies regardless of any other laws enacted.
